summary: Air travel for people with disabilities can be very challenging if airport facilities aren't accessible and reasonable accommodations aren't provided. Passengers with disabilities face infrastructure, information, and customer service barriers at U.S. airports. For example, complex terminal layouts and long distances between gates can be hard to navigate. Additionally, travel information isn't always available in a format that is accessible to all. title: Passengers with Disabilities: Airport Accessibility Barriers and Practices and DOT's Oversight of Airlines' Disability-Related Training
